g.text: CreateHandle works either by a NodeId + Name pair (NodeId is treated as parent node id)
or directly by NodeId (NodeId is treated as the file node id to open). In practice the
predominant case is CreateHandle by NodeId. For example, if user code opens a file via the
openat syscall and passes an absolute path to it, path elements will be iteratively resolved
to their NodeIds via the stat call (GetNodeAttr) using parent NodeId + Name pairs and,
when the opened file NodeId gets resolved, the actual open (CreateHandle) call will be issued
using the opened file NodeId. But files can be created via the open call family (when called
with O_CREAT flag) - in this case there is no way around the CreateHandle with parent NodeId
+ child Name call.
CreateHandle using file NodeId is simply forwarded to the right shard using ShardNo which is stored
in the high 8 bits of NodeId.
CreateHandle using parent NodeId and child Name is more complex, we'll review it here.
CreateHandle
To read or write some data to a file, you need to open it first. CreateHandle request
is used to open a file. CreateHandleResponse contains a ui64 HandleId which works as a
file descriptor and is used to read and write and, eventually, to close the file. ShardNo is
stored in the high 8 bits of HandleId (just like in NodeId) and read/write/close requests -
ReadData, DescribeData, WriteData, GenerateBlobIds, AddData, DestroyHandle - are
forwarded directly to the shard which issued the file handle. Forwarding happens at the
TStorageServiceActor level. The only relatively complex thing here is CreateHandle - we'll
focus on it here.
TStorageServiceActor
Main Tablet
1. CreateHandle
LocalDB
If O_CREAT flag is present
4. ShardId
+ NodeNameInShard
2. NodeRefs + DupCache + OpLog update
Shard
3. CreateNode in shard
via OpLog (see node
creation doc)
5. CreateHandle by NodeId
7. Response with Handle
LocalDB
6. Nodes + NodeRefs + DupCache update
Note: if O_EXCL flag is used, it's
reset in the request to shard since
retries are possible and O_EXCL flag
breaks idempotency
exclusiveness condition is checked in the
main tablet, so it's fine
